g.text: The table shows average US retail residential prices of
electricity from 2000 to 2012, measured in cents per
Make a scatter plot. ±s a linear model appropriate?
Find and graph the regression line.
Use your linear model from part (b) to estimate the
average retail price of electricity in 2005 and 2013.
Many physical quantities are connected by
, that is, by power functions of the form
±n particular, the illumination of an object by a light source
is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from
the source. Suppose that after dark you are in a room with
just one lamp and you are trying to read a book. The light is
too dim and so you move halfway to the lamp. How much
±t makes sense that the larger the area of a region, the larger
the number of species that inhabit the region. Many ecolo-
gists have modeled the species-area relation with a power
function and, in particular, the number of species
living in caves in central Mexico has been related to the
of the caves by the equation
Mexico, has a surface area of
species of bats would you expect to Ind in that cave?
±f you discover that four species of bats live in a cave,
estimate the area of the cave.
amphibians inhabiting Caribbean islands and the area
Use a power function to model
The Caribbean island of Dominica has area 291 mi
How many species of reptiles and amphibians would
you expect to Ind on Dominica?
The table shows the mean (average) distances
planets from the sun (taking the unit of measurement to be
the distance from the earth to the sun) and their periods
(a) Fit a power model to the data.
Kepler’s Third Law of Planetary Motion states that
“The square of the period of revolution of a planet
is proportional to the cube of its mean distance from
Does your model corroborate Kepler’s Third Law?
±n this section we start with the basic functions we discussed in Section 1.2 and obtain
new functions by shifting, stretching, and re²ecting their graphs. We also show how to
combine pairs of functions by the standard arithmetic operations and by composition.
By applying certain transformations to the graph of a given function we can obtain
the graphs of related functions. This will give us the ability to sketch the graphs of
many functions quickly by hand. ±t will also enable us to write equations for given graphs.
is a positive number, then the graph of
